website_summaries.verdict: Stable rack that can easily be stored.
pros: Safety bar catches to ensure that athletes can lift 500 pounds
Space saver, can be easily stored away

customer_reviews.title: Freaking love this rack
customer_reviews.text: Freaking love this rack. Very space efficient. There are plenty of youtube videos to see it in action and seal the decision. Oveall the quality is good. Added a 25lb weight plates to the pegs and it is very solid. Fits very well in a small apt. I have the foto pegs on the smalles extension as i use this as a bench and i feel very cumfortable with the unit.
customer_reviews.author: E

customer_reviews.title: Was good enough to get me to write my first review.
customer_reviews.text: Quite possibly the best thing I've bought on Amazon. The price is great. Valor fitness has all kinds of literature about what to do if your product arrives damaged or missing pieces( thankfully mine did not). Easy assembly. Lightweight and highly portable. Setting up/breaking down and stowing in my carport takes less than five minutes, and I still feel comfortable putting over 200lbs on it at shoulder height for squats. I did some strict pull-ups and it felt solid, even with only 80lbs on each base(I'm 205lbs). This product was good enough to get me to write my first review.
customer_reviews.author: joe

customer_reviews.title: Exceeded expectations, very pleased with this rack set.
customer_reviews.text: Great rack for my 4' weight/curl bar. Heavy, sturdy, holds my plates, bands and my weighted bar. Easy to put together, works great for what I bought it for.
customer_reviews.author: Salinwa

customer_reviews.title: Does the trick for at home squats.
customer_reviews.text: Pretty simple concept. Not idiot proof to assemble. But very useful for average home gamer. If you have small hole weights or larger hole and keep things under 300lb, this works well. It is ideal if you work out with a partner or kid and are at a stage where your squat rep weight is where you can't press the weight onto your shoulders but aren't like competitive powerlifting with massive amounts that would crush this rack or tip it over.... It is also pretty easy to move around the garage.
customer_reviews.author: R.B Family

customer_reviews.title: Strong build quality, highly versatile, but small spot bars
customer_reviews.text: This product is very stable, durable, and easy to assemble. You can easily bench and squat with it. It’s stable on a carpet for bench pressing with over 300lbs. My only complaint is that the spot bars are extremely short. They’re pretty much useless. I ended up purchasing standalone drop/spotter bars by TDS Fitness, which are much more stable and sturdy than the spot bars included with the Valor fitness stands. Otherwise, this is an excellent product and well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: DT

customer_reviews.title: Quality material and sturdy
customer_reviews.text: This was a must have for my home gym. It was easy to put together, the materials that its made of seem to be quality, and I have had no problems with it. Lets be honest though, you get what you pay for, this isn't some world class piece of equipment, but it does its job, can hold weight and looks nice. I am happy I purchased this as an addition to my home gym.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Schueller

customer_reviews.title: Good product.  Make sure you have all of the parts with it.
customer_reviews.text: Well made product. My package came in damaged and missing several pieces/ parts. Customer service was spot on to help send the remaining parts, but sent a different height adjustment sleeve cover that was smooth and not notched like the original one was. When emailed for correct piece, never replied. This is why 3 stars and not higher. Excellent product though.
customer_reviews.author: G-officus

customer_reviews.title: unencumbered
customer_reviews.text: I have enclosed two photos of the BD-9 stands and bb setting in place ready for use. As weight is loaded onto bb it becomes more difficult to unseat for a clean and unencumbered lift-off. The bb actually becomes wedged in the angel created by the stand and welded support for the bar. When I first received the BD-9, I have put duck tape on bb and stand. This was “okay” for lighter weight, but useless as weight increases. I am lifting 230+ it becomes quite an obstruction to a clean lift.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good product
customer_reviews.text: Pretty good product. I’m a tad intimidated to throw the weights back on. But that’s because I’ve never used a in home bench/squat rack. Only the sturdy gym racks. The only annoying part is how non friendly lowering and raising the bars is. My wife wants to use it on occasion and she needs to undo a lot of screws and what not to make it her size. We could never use it together really. I might be able to make it work since I’m taller but it wouldn’t be ideal. Overall still a good product for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: used it for bench only so far and it works fine. i would like to get those storage pegs ...
customer_reviews.text: parts were missing out of the box. the pegs for plate storage were missing from the box. also, 2 of the 4 "T" base barts did not fit. i had to get a vise grip to bend the opening enough so that i could slide them in. one of the bases functions perfectly, the other rocks slightly. used it for bench only so far and it works fine. i would like to get those storage pegs so that i can add some weight to the base. Gonna try and call customer service to get those parts tomorrow.
customer_reviews.author: Brent P

customer_reviews.title: Love these so much I bought a second set!
customer_reviews.text: Amazingly sturdy squat stand, even sitting on our workout room floor with the foam flooring. I did not even have to put weights on it to stabilize. The height adjustment is very easy to manipulate and goes low enough for me at 5'3" tall:) The lower holds can be used for benchpress. My husband and I have been using these so much that we bought a second set so we can each have one when are workout days coincide.
customer_reviews.author: Emily Murray

customer_reviews.title: Great option for both bench and squat and so much flexibilty in moving around
customer_reviews.text: I own a bowflex so I wanted something that I can do squats on as well as use the bench and do presses with. This is working perfectly because I can move them easily for any exercise. One thing you need to get used to on doing squats is that if you like to just push the barbell into the squat rack, you can't just do that on this because they'll tip a little. For bench pressing I like the added hangars so I've got it set for benching and then can easily move for squats without any alterations. Would highly recommend this for anyone wanting to do some barbell work.
customer_reviews.author: J. Curtis

customer_reviews.title: Great!  I would buy this again.
customer_reviews.text: They work great! If you have a small area but want something that functions as a squat rack, this works great! I am able to store it in the corner of my workout room and it doesn’t take up a lot of space. It was easy to put together and took me about 30 minutes total to get it together. I haven’t used over 150# on this unit. It would also work great as a spotter for bench presses.
customer_reviews.author: Natalya

customer_reviews.title: Ya' ready to get ripped, bro?
customer_reviews.text: These are great. Stay away from the cheapie sets. I have mine set up on carpet and they are super steady once weight is on the base. I've even cranked mine up to max height and did pull-ups with an Olympic bar. The locks take a bit to get used to. Note: A few reviewers complained the bases wobble. Yeah, they wobble if you're mechanically inept. Just make sure you tighten everything down all the way and the wobble stops. Also, mine came with a broken plastic piece and Valor 2-day mailed me a replacement part no questions asked. Outstanding customer service. These are super versatile, sturdy and well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: This thing is exactly what I needed. I needed a compact squat stand to throw in the corner of my garage when I didn't need it. Yet its also build well. I feel safe and secure while using it. I did add some plates to the pins while lifting though to add extra stability, as some people recommended doing. Which works well
customer_reviews.author: Philip

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: The most I have added to this stand is 225lbs. They are fairly light and seem to knock over easy if you're not careful. They're handling what I bought them for so I gave them 5 stars. If anything changes ill update. I'm happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Ruben Franco

customer_reviews.title: Good for squats but not as well for benchpress
customer_reviews.text: It is sturdy and flexible for the price. The assembling of screws and washers required two wrenches, they are also in the metric system so you had to get the metrics system wrenches. The design is good for squats, but not for bench press. The holders for the bench press has two uneven layers. During bench press, when you want to return the bar to the original position, the bar will clip the overlap of the two layers, causing inconvenience. Overall a good product for the price. Also, it is conveniently used for a 5-6 feet bar so great for a home gym.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The stands in general are quite sturdy as long as the weights are on the bottom ...
customer_reviews.text: The stands do everything that I need them to do. The squat portion of the stands hold 500lbs and the bench portion of the stands hold 350lbs, The stands in general are quite sturdy as long as the weights are on the bottom pegs. They are easy to use and easy to assemble, and they do not take up much room after use. For the price you cannot beat them.
customer_reviews.author: Austin Shettler

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for the home gym
customer_reviews.text: Simple too assemble. Easy to move around and put up once your done. Doesn't take up alot of space. I'm 5'10 and the height can go up much higher if needed. Perfect for the home gym. 4 stars given because of the bar holders. I wish they had a plastic insert to protect my bar. Fixed with layers of duct tape. Also you will need to anchor down with plates to make it more stable when lifting heavy weight. Great buy for the money though.
customer_reviews.author: Levi

customer_reviews.title: SOLID, SAFE, and SIMPLE!
customer_reviews.text: AWESOME! Very easy assembly. Well made. Between the Squat rack, the press rack, and the safety rack you have three options to put a bar. The safety rack is great for putting a curl bar between sets instead of bending down to pick up. Multiple safety features. Solid build. Really recommend this!
customer_reviews.author: Sherman

customer_reviews.title: Takes up much less room than the alternatives
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little setup if you want to conserve space. You do have to be careful. If you are using it without weights on the holders at the bottom, it can be very top heavy and possibly top over. But, what would you expect with something like this. It was exactly what I was looking for.
customer_reviews.author: bworby

customer_reviews.title: I love my power squat stand
customer_reviews.text: I love my power squat stand. I would say the only down side is they are a bit tipsy but have never fallen over. If you ensure you have weight on the base pegs they feel more sturdy but in the end they are not designed to catch the weights if you get into trouble. Better just dropping them than trying to get the rack to catch them. However using it for bench press and letting it catch the weights is very good! But you obviously need it set up correctly in order to do that.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Nice squat rack!
customer_reviews.text: This squat rack is great. You can adjust it in many different ways to fit your needs and lifting purposes. Very easy to put together and got here in a timely matter. The price alone is a no brainier of you're looking for a decent home squat rack
customer_reviews.author: Jess

customer_reviews.title: Great squat rack for low ceilings
customer_reviews.text: Works perfectly for what I needed. I have a low ceiling basement that a normal squat rack would not fit in, usually because of the pull-up bar. This one does not have that, and it makes for a wonderful squat rack, and bench rack. Like others have said, you do need weights in the bottom to stabilize it, but we have some extras we just leave on there.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle T Barta

customer_reviews.title: These things are doing great. Have had them for quite some time in ...
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for a small garage squat setup. These things are doing great. Have had them for quite some time in two different garages. I was able to stack them up pretty small and still get the car to still fit when we were in a 1 car garage. And now in a 2 car garage, they stay setup with a bar on it all day.
customer_reviews.author: Lackey

customer_reviews.title: versatile stand
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for a small home gym. Allows you to do shoulder presses, squat, bench, as well as start other exercises from a standing position instead of having to pick the weight up off the floor first. The only problems I had were that the paint on the top catch came scratched down to the bare metal. Also the bottom tube where the legs slide into came pinched and had to be bent straight so that it would accept the legs. What was most surprising was how easy it was to bend the metal back into shape, reveals the quality of metal they used. But for the price, no one makes anything better.
customer_reviews.author: suks2beeu

customer_reviews.title: Easy assembly and substantial footprint are two major pluses with ...
customer_reviews.text: Easy assembly and substantial footprint are two major pluses with this squat stand. Heavy gauge metal looks like it will be around for a long time. All-in-all I have yet to really find anything to not like.
customer_reviews.author: JDS

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: I love this rack. Super sturdy and easy to assemble. This is the second equipment item from Valor that I have purchased, and they have not let me down.
customer_reviews.author: jasonthegreat

customer_reviews.title: Very good product!
customer_reviews.text: This product was better than I imagined. It is durable, solid and it looks good. I love the fact that I can easily move it around when I need more room in my garage. Adhere to the specs and weight loads; which I definitely do not exceed.
customer_reviews.author: Jody

customer_reviews.title: Great for home gym and moderate weight load
customer_reviews.text: Intuitive set up (need to read instructions carefully) that takes about an hour. Relatively stable and good for a home gym. I feel comfortable using it for ~260 lbs squats. Note it wobbles a bit so I’d use weights you can handle.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Well built and functional
customer_reviews.text: Works exactly as intended and advertised. Owned for several months now and would buy it again. Obviously not for gym rats but perfectly suitable for a 50's plus guy trying to stay in some sort of shape. Great value for the money, saves space, and assembly was easy.
customer_reviews.author: Gscheiter

customer_reviews.title: Good stands
customer_reviews.text: These squat stands are great. Pros: 1. Very portable. 2. Does not take up alot of space. Cons: 1. Can be a little cumbersome adjusting the bar catches between different types of exercises. 2. A little wobbly (like others mentioned) so keeping weights on the pegs is a must (i bought two 45lb barbells just for that purpose). Overall I am happy with this addition to my home gym and it pairs well with the bh 9 storage rack.
customer_reviews.author: R. Lewis

customer_reviews.title: I love these stands!
customer_reviews.text: They're perfect for me and what I'm doing. This bigger version (I'm 6'4") works out well with room to spare. They even stack side by side when I need the room. They're simple to operate, look great, and do the job they're supposed to do. I do wish it was a couple inches taller on the main body for when I do incline presses. It still works great, but my long arms could use a little more room. My only other gripe, to be fair, is that the bar for the weight holders on the bottom scrape off pretty easily. I honestly could care less but others might.
customer_reviews.author: Lyle

customer_reviews.title: I am glad i got these because they are easy to move ...
customer_reviews.text: This squat stand is solid! I was trying to save space in my garage so i wanted two stands. I am glad i got these because they are easy to move around when needed. Make sure you put about 50 pounds (two 25 lb plates) on each stand though so it does not move when you place the bar on the stands. The quality is great for the price!
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: Great squat stand
customer_reviews.text: This is a perfect stand for a basement/garage gym. You can't beat it for the price.They're relatively sturdy when racking/re-racking the bar, I would definitely recommend stacking a few plates on the holders on each side to add stability. I haven't loaded anything too far above 300lb so I can't speak to the stability under those kinds of loads, but for anything up to 300lb it's been really solid. I've been very impressed.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy Heintz

customer_reviews.title: It is a little better after gluing leather straps onto the v-cups but you ...
customer_reviews.text: It gets the job done for the price you pay. This is not for heavy bench work. The safety catches barely come past the chin. Some of the jagged edges tore up the knurling on my barbell. It is a little better after gluing leather straps onto the v-cups but you might want to invest in a Rogue rack or squat stand if you are looking for stands that support heavy bench work and protect your bars.
customer_reviews.author: Gorilla Taco

customer_reviews.title: No setup instructions
customer_reviews.text: I'll update the review after installing it, but it's very frustrating that it came without any installation/setup instructions and there's not a single link to anything available on the manufacturer's site. Update: Amazon sent a replacement just so I can get the manual so I uploaded the images in case anyone else runs into this issue in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Abdullah Jibaly

customer_reviews.title: God quality, space saving.
customer_reviews.text: Reviews saying that the bolts wiggle and don’t quite fit need to tighten the bolts harder and ensure the washers are being utilize. Stands are great for having a spot for the squat and bench position. I use the catch as a great deadlift, being a little taller probably helps. Happy with the purchase and the space saving. Customer service was extremely helpful and responded back promptly hence the 5 star review.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas

customer_reviews.title: BD9 stand
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with my purchase. The stand is a great addition to my home gym. I wish the spotters were longer and the instructions were written more clearly. It is not very sturdy but adding 25+ pounds to the base fixes the issue. I recommend to everyone who cant afford a rack or tight on space. Installation tip: use 2 washers per screw or you will end up with 8 extra ones.
customer_reviews.author: Brittany G.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Choice...couldn't be happier!
customer_reviews.text: I did alot of research before choosing these. I'm tall 6'2, so I needed something that would be stable when extended upward. These stands deliver! Very solid with whatever you throw at them! They are rated at 600lbs capacity which should be more than enough for most guys. I live in a apt so my space is limited. These are the perfect solution. They only weigh 27 lbs each so they are easy to move around, perfect for tight areas. Shipping wa
customer_reviews.author: Mark Roane

customer_reviews.title: Strong, balanced and space efficient.
customer_reviews.text: A space efficient addition to my backyard gym. The uprights are sturdy and easy to put together. I did take some foam tape and add it to the upright rests which are just painted metal and were scratching my bar. I am also going to add another spindle on the back of the unit for more plate storage.
customer_reviews.author: Sean Ross

customer_reviews.title: Best option if you can't afford a power rack
customer_reviews.text: Best option if you can't afford a power rack. Easy to put together and seem very sturdy once you put a couple of 45 pound plates on them. Pull-ups are a kind of sketchy but it gets the job done for me being around 5'7. Been doing squats, overhead presses and rows with no problem. Although the actual place on the very top where you rest the bar is very rough and causes wear to the knurling of olympic bars after a while.
customer_reviews.author: Anik

customer_reviews.title: good stand
customer_reviews.text: this really is a great stand. I can do squats on one side and move the bar to the other side for chest press. The bar on the bottom to hold weights doesn't do much, especially if you have different sized plates
customer_reviews.author: Jamie G

customer_reviews.title: Definitely don't over tighten the height adjustment screws
customer_reviews.text: The only thing I can say is that these have been great all around, except you definitely have to be careful not to over tighten the adjuster screws on it. If you do, then go to change the height later on, it can cause the screw/spring combo to come out of the bigger head piece. It's an easy fix to screw it back in, but definitely a surprise when it first happens.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Scott

customer_reviews.title: Does what I need
customer_reviews.text: This pair of squat racks is sturdily built and very stable. I wanted a squat rack so that I could do heavier benches and squats; these stands fulfill my needs. I like that they are adjustable and are two separate stands, which makes for easy storage. When squatting, I like to put weight on the pegs, so that I can feel when the bar has hit the catch. These are very versatile, sturdy, and well designed squat stands.
customer_reviews.author: Peter G. Hamilton

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy Dependable Construction
customer_reviews.text: Squat, bench, shoulder press from these racks. Former long-time Worlds Gym member was concerned might not hold up to rigors of heavier weights in 250# range. Just weight them down on weight post. Very pleased. Solid construction. No issues after six months of heavy use. Work out at home and save time driving to and from gym.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cheap, gets the job done.
customer_reviews.text: Compact, pretty stable for a small squat stand. Better qualty than expected at this price.
customer_reviews.author: Christine M.

customer_reviews.title: Love these. The perfect solution for at-home lifters lacking ...
customer_reviews.text: Love these. The perfect solution for at-home lifters lacking space. I've put over 300 lbs on it, and it's plenty stable (and I don't even have a level foundation), as long as you have a couple of #45s on the bottom. The adjustable height feature is great, and it suits both my 6'2" husband and myself (I'm 5'10") perfectly. Definitely recommend these.
customer_reviews.author: Lea Ramirez

customer_reviews.title: Solid Rack!
customer_reviews.text: These squat stands are solid. They came securely packaged and only took about 20 minutes to put together. I immedietly used them in a workout and was quite impressed at how sturdy the felt. The materials feel quality and durable. Storing these stands will also be easy because they are not attached. I love them so far and highly recommend. They are well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua brown

customer_reviews.title: Space benefit and awesome PT improvement
customer_reviews.text: I appreciate the fact that these weight racks can help save space and most of still squat at home. It is a must have for those that have a 3.1 Bowflex bench but lack the capability of being able to bench press and squat, instead head to the crowded gym and waste time to utilize a desire equipment for these exercises. All in one with these racks....YA
customer_reviews.author: eddie

customer_reviews.title: could be more stable
customer_reviews.text: These work great for me because I don't have a tremendous amount of room in my home gym. These are pretty mobile and assemble easily, they fit onto existing bench to add versatility which is nice. They are not incredibly stable, they wiggle a good bit however, that may be due to the fact that I have them set up on top of the foam pad floor system not directly on the concrete.
customer_reviews.author: Wesley Briant

customer_reviews.title: WORTH EVERY PENNY
customer_reviews.text: Buy this, you will not regret it. As a woman, it was so difficult to squat at my potential because I could not lift the weight to my shoulders. Now, with this product, I am able to squat twice as much as before. I cannot brag about this product enough. Great quality. Dare I say, I now love squatting; okay, maybe that's going a little too far.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: great product - yes, it can tilt....if you're a wheenie baby who doesn't know how to use squat stands.
customer_reviews.author: David R.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Totally love mine. Well built, stable and ensures safety while working out. I would definitely purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph R. Lang

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: The directions aren't extensive for putting it together, but take it slow and easy and you'll get it. Assembly took me probably 20 minutes. Put some weight on the bottom racks or some dumbbells on the feet and its very sturdy. Only put on 135 so far but I'm confident this rack will be great!
customer_reviews.author: Charles D.

customer_reviews.title: Works As Designed, No Complaints
customer_reviews.text: Works fine, no issues. My main concern was finding something that would let me do squats as well as have catches for bench as I work out alone at home. The catches are fine for bench, for squats just gotta be more careful or drop on floor.
customer_reviews.author: Russell D. Holloway

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, well build
customer_reviews.text: I have been in Crossfit for 4+ years. Wanted something at home to mimic the "box". Since I travel and cannot get to Crossfit at times, this equipment is valuable helping me to keep up the effort. Sturdy, well build, "as is advertised". Very please with purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Charlakos

customer_reviews.title: Awesome squat / bench press rack
customer_reviews.text: Awesome squat / bench press rack; however, there must be weights on the bottom racks at all times to prevent it from swaying backwards.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Nice squat stand especially given the price
customer_reviews.text: Nice squat stand especially given the price. Versatile and can do bench presses with it no problem. Need to put weights on the weightholders to keep it sturdy though. Only criticism are: 1) tonnes of metal shavings left inside the stand (manufacturer sloppy?) and 2) the weightholder cylinder things were uneven, with difficulty install it on one side (bent) Assembly is pretty easy even with limited instructions, contrary to some reviews.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick

customer_reviews.title: it's annoying as it will sometimes shift and the bar end ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought it for a portable rack that I can put in the closet. Worked exactly as described. With plates on the bottom no fear of it tipping over. Only thing, it's annoying as it will sometimes shift and the bar end up being on an angle.
customer_reviews.author: William

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product, unresponsive seller.
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy and solid support once weights are added. Only reason for 4 stars is for the lack of response from the seller (Valor Fitness). I did not receive all the rubber pads as shown on the manual. I called and emailed Valor Fitness and got no response from them. Otherwise the product is great.
customer_reviews.author: A. Gonzalez

customer_reviews.title: These squat stands are well designed and excellent for almost any home gym
customer_reviews.text: These squat stands are well designed and excellent for almost any home gym. Easily movable, very stable when weighted with thirty or forty pounds and able to handle probably even more weight than they are rated for. Unless you're a power lifter, they certainly fit into almost any lifters program. The bench press feature is great for anyone who trains solo. I rate these five stars, simply because they do everything promised. The additional height is a nice benefit for anyone who has struggled with shorter racks.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Popovich

customer_reviews.title: Good temporary weight set for tight locations for the money
customer_reviews.text: Good temporary weight set for tight locations for the money. Definitely want to put weights on bottom to keep from tipping over when doing bench or squats. Well made.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Sogn

customer_reviews.title: I love it, but I still haven't figured out how ...
customer_reviews.text: I love it, but I still haven't figured out how to adjust the height. I'm geussing you might need tools to do it. But it's great if your in a small apartment.
customer_reviews.author: Deags

customer_reviews.title: Effective and Dependable.
customer_reviews.text: Easy setup, Solid materials, Get to work stands, and really great in a limited space area. Need more stability weigh them down with a couple of weight plates with the pegs provided and you will cherish these always.
customer_reviews.author: UPSTREAM

customer_reviews.title: A must have
customer_reviews.text: These stands are GREAT. They are everything I needed and more. Assembly was easy. I AM NOT HANDY AT ALL!!!!! But I assembled them quickly. They are very sturdy and handle weight with ease.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Brown

customer_reviews.title: Missing pieces
customer_reviews.text: There were many missing pieces for this item. Could not put together all the M10 bolts, lock nuts and washers were missing. This makes the item completely useless. Less important all the tube plugs and 1 plate storage peg were missing.
customer_reviews.author: RBruce

customer_reviews.title: Because I don't have space for a power cage.
customer_reviews.text: I've been using these primarily for squats and overhead press. Base is a little wide and somehow doesn't seem symetrical, but if you don't have space for a power cage, this will do. Height is adjustable. I don't use it for bench pressing.
customer_reviews.author: Adrian Vazquez

customer_reviews.title: Works great. but the safety bars sticking out hit my ...
customer_reviews.text: Works great. but the safety bars sticking out hit my elbows when I do bench press. I may just take them out. The hook for the bar could be bigger as well its so short I've missed it a few times trying to hook it on. It's very versatile and adjustable and easily movable which I like. I do recommend it but takes a bit of time to assemble.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory Harder

customer_reviews.title: Nice to be able to change the width whenever needed
customer_reviews.text: Delivered fast! No dramatics, no damage, no problem! Very solid stands. Nice to be able to change the width whenever needed. There is a slight side to side play because of the space needed for sliding for height adjustment that is unavoidable with any two piece unit. But it is not unstable. The only way to eliminate the play would be to either weld or shim them tight together which would of course prevent anymore adjustability.
customer_reviews.author: William Hawley

customer_reviews.title: Best squat rack, doesnt take up alot of space
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to assemble and when im finished i can just tuck the rack away in the corner. I do crossfit so i mainly bought the rack for back and front squats. I don't squat extremely heavy, my max squat is 160lbs right now and this is very sturdy! no complaints!
customer_reviews.author: Brooklyn Nerd

customer_reviews.title: Just what was wanted
customer_reviews.text: My son-in-law says it is great. Additionally, since it is made in the USA he feels that it is a very sturdy piece of fitness equipment. Ordering it thru Amazon Prime is an added benefit as I ordered another piece from the same manufacturer which arrived at a much later date.
customer_reviews.author: avid reader

customer_reviews.title: Time will tell
customer_reviews.text: So far, so good. Assembly instructions leave much to be desired, and one of the plastic guards on the uprights broke, something that would have been easily avoided had the instructions been decent. But in use, it's pretty much what we'd expected.
customer_reviews.author: ejw2010

customer_reviews.title: Great for the home gym
customer_reviews.text: Great for the home gym. Pretty sturdy. I don't have a heavy plate to keep on the stand to help stabilize as others mention, but I am also maxing out at 100 pounds total so don't really need that extra stabilization just yet
customer_reviews.author: bzgl40

customer_reviews.title: Space saving squats!
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't take up too much space and can be moved and stored pretty easily. I'm not a huge guy so I've not had any trouble with stability, but I imagine if that's a problem you can just put some heavier weights on the storage pegs.
customer_reviews.author: hutch

customer_reviews.title: Love them
customer_reviews.text: Love these stands. Wanted stands instead of a rack b/c it fits in my garage better and I like the fact that I can easily move them if I have to. I do the StrongLifts 5x5 program and this works perfect. Love the fact that I can go from squats, to bench, to deadlifts, overhead presses, and rows without having to adjust the rack. Works perfect. I keep 60lbs on the bottom of each stand as I have extra plates and this keeps them secure. Great buy and definately recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Aharr80

customer_reviews.title: Exactly as advertised
customer_reviews.text: This was exactly what I was looking for. Sturdy and strong. Assembly was quick and easy.
customer_reviews.author: Oscar Chicas

customer_reviews.title: Great piece of equipment
customer_reviews.text: Exceeded my expectations well built piece of equipment at a great price I've been looking for a versatile squat combo rack for limited space in my apartment and this valor bd-9 is perfect it's great for bench presses incline and decline if you have the right bench squats,calf raises,shoulders etc...... I couldn't be happier with my purchase thanks valor fitness
customer_reviews.author: Antjl

customer_reviews.title: Good value for Home Gym
customer_reviews.text: Nice setup if you are limited on space. You can do Squats, Bench, Military Press. Make sure to get some weights to keep the two stands stable because they do rock a bit with heavier weights. Easy assembly, takes some getting used to when adjusting for bench and military press.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Fitzgerald

customer_reviews.title: Probably my best fitness purchase.
customer_reviews.text: These stands are perfect. If you get some weights, a nice bar and a quality bench you are ready to tear it up. I lift alone and feel confident in doing so thanks to Valor squat stands. I would buy them again in a heartbeat.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice deal, good for small spaces.
customer_reviews.text: Does the trick while I am stuck in a place too small for a power rack. Mine arrived with some rust and paint chipping at the bottom. They include paint to patch it up but, overall I think this is about what I expect for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Joe McDonagh

customer_reviews.title: One of the adjustable uprights was crooked, so when ...
customer_reviews.text: One of the adjustable uprights was crooked, so when I try to lock it in with the poppers, the uprights aren’t even. It’s not that noticeable until I try to back to rest the bar after a set of squats,
customer_reviews.author: Adrian H.

customer_reviews.title: Good stuff
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install Pretty steady Good quality for the price
customer_reviews.author: Antoine

customer_reviews.title: Awesome stands! Adjustable to accomidate different needs of bar ...
customer_reviews.text: Awesome stands! Adjustable to accomidate different needs of bar lengths. Easy to put together. Had some tiping problems at first, but as others have mentioned, back them to a wall or weigh down with some plates. Issues resolved
customer_reviews.author: Korrosive

customer_reviews.title: It does the job
customer_reviews.text: These are great squat stands. Easy to put together and very well made. I recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon_Customer

customer_reviews.title: They're sturdy in my experience
customer_reviews.text: I feel perfectly safe doing squats and benching alone with these. They're sturdy in my experience, but I've never loaded them past 250 on the top.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Kash

customer_reviews.title: Solid rack that doesn't take up the entire room
customer_reviews.text: This would be a five star rating except for the fact that they are a bit cumbersome to adjust the height of the stops, and bar slots. The plus side is once it is set where you want it you don't need to move them. They are very light weight and easily stashed in a closet when you are finished. Very solid!
customer_reviews.author: Salt Living

customer_reviews.title: Latch/Locking System is Shady
customer_reviews.text: This is a great item for an economical gym. Sadly it is small and has its gripes. The latch system can be kind of faulty at times so make sure the rack is secure before lifting.
customer_reviews.author: Danny

customer_reviews.title: Really love these. I use these for squats and as ...
customer_reviews.text: Really love these. I use these for squats and as a benchpress rack as well. I squat 225 with this no problem. Solid bars.
customer_reviews.author: CK

customer_reviews.title: Easy to put together an perfect size
customer_reviews.text: Very well made . Easy to put together an perfect size
customer_reviews.author: Gio 22

customer_reviews.title: Space saver with good quality for good price
customer_reviews.text: Space saver when needed but can take up some room. Easy to assemble but jus a little loose at the very top. Overall very stable since each weigh approx 25 lbs and with a 45 lb plate on plate holder towards base should hold very well at the base. Can do multiple exercises with which is great. Getting a bench to bench press on soon and im sure itll work out jus great. Better investment I've made so far for a home gym.
customer_reviews.author: xchang05

customer_reviews.title: These were easy to assemble and work great
customer_reviews.text: These were easy to assemble and work great. They do wobble a bit but this can be mitigated by using a plate for support.
customer_reviews.author: Paul S GC

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: So i have been using this for two weeks with 35lb weights on the pegs for most of it and it is extremely sturdy, you could probably get away with less on the pegs. Setup took about 30 minutes and my only complaint is that the place where i have my bench and safety pegs i cant actually use the hole for the safety peg because there is no hole drilled that low (my bench is to low i guess) or i cant do a full rep when i go to bench. I just leave the safety bar resting on the diagonal support and i have failed a rep once and they saved me.
customer_reviews.author: Katie Ferrell

customer_reviews.title: These things are great. Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: These things are great. Sturdy, well made, great quality for the price. I had one small broken plastic piece, and Valor sent me a replacement immediately after I contacted them about it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: ... it would have 5 stars if the instructions were better. Great for a home gym
customer_reviews.text: Just put this together and it would have 5 stars if the instructions were better. Great for a home gym, just bought a 300lbs weight set from Dick's to go with it. You need a 17mm socket wrench-took me a long time to figure it out, hope this helps you put it together!
customer_reviews.author: Harrison

customer_reviews.title: Was nervous about these standing independent but ive never had ...
customer_reviews.text: Was nervous about these standing independent but ive never had them so much as wobble a tiny bit. Even when moving 200lbs on the top everything is secure.
customer_reviews.author: ChrisL89

customer_reviews.title: Very nice for a home starter gym.
customer_reviews.text: My son (15 yrs old) just started lifting, these racks do the job very nicely for a home gym. Put a couple of 25lbs plates on the rack plate holders and they are securely anchored. Very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Juan M Mendez

customer_reviews.title: Great equipment! secure enough to load up over 300# ...
customer_reviews.text: Great equipment! secure enough to load up over 300# when I squat.(with wts on their storage rack). There is fantastic customer support at Valor(I needed some help) but they were easily assembled. I highly reccomend
customer_reviews.author: st

customer_reviews.title: I am very happy of this purchase since they don't sell anything like ...
customer_reviews.text: Very durable squat/bench rack. Item was shipped to a PO Box in Guam. All parts came in complete but one of the plastic pieces came in cracked. I am very happy of this purchase since they don't sell anything like this on island. Make sure to use weights to keep it stable.
customer_reviews.author: Jäger

customer_reviews.title: Great squat rack for a home gym
customer_reviews.text: Great squat rack for a home gym, especially if space is a concern. They're not too big or too heavy, but they get the job done, and were exactly what I was looking for.
customer_reviews.author: Draven

product_meta.title: Valor Fitness BD-9 Independent Power Squat Stands with Adjustable Uprights, J-Hooks, Bar Catches, and Safety Catches
feature_bullets: HEAVY DUTY- Constructed of 13-gauge steel with 2” x 2” tubing for strength and durability. Rubber end caps encase each foot for added stability and floor protection.

VERSATILE- Mainly functions as a squat stand, but with independent uprights it can easily accommodate a bench to perform bench presses. Storage pegs add functionality to the unit and make it more stable when loaded with plates.
ADJUSTABLE- Uprights adjust between 10 different heights from 48. 5” to 70” tall. Also included are adjustable safety catches from 24. 75” to 38. 5” in 11 different positions.
EXPANDABLE FOOT BASE- 3 position adjustable base for larger footprint to add more stability. Minimum length of foot base is 20”, with a maximum of 28”.
ADDITIONAL- Meant for home gym or light-commercial use. Max weight load of 350 lb. directed downward. Storage pegs compatible with EX-10 Olympic Adapter Sleeve (sold separately).

Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
